results.title: 1893-1901: early Edison films
results.brief_description: A compilation of 19 Thomas Edison films, some made for use in kinetoscopes others for public projection, averaging less than one minute each. Most are single shot films except ‘McKinley’s Inauguration’ and ‘Admiral Dewey at Manila Bay’ which are made up of several shots. Includes “Washing the Baby” (1893) and “Inauguration of President McKinley” (1896) and what is regarded as the first advertising film.

results.creator_credit: Co-operative Generale du Cinema Francais, Victoria Mercanton, Marguerite de la Mure and Albert Soboul
results.brief_description: NARRATED IN FRENCH. NO ENGLISH SUBTITLES. Uses drawings and contemporary engravings by Daumier, Gauarni, Decamps and others to depict the period of the 1848 Revolution in France. Examines the causes for discontent as the monarchy totters, the fierce street fighting that precipitated its downfall, and finally the election of Louis Napoleon and the celebration of the new freedom - and the betrayal of that freedom.

results.title: 180 is max
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall and Bill Pettigrew
results.brief_description: The twenty-third world championship match for builders of free-flight model aircraft, held at Goteborg, Sweden, in July 1971, in which a Canadian team competed. The film follows the successful flights and the failures, as competitors attempt to get their fragile handmade craft airborne by whatever means. (Award: Milan)

results.title: 150 to the acre
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), James Allen, Jean Hunt, Murray Brown and Robert Newton
results.brief_description: Discusses the problems arising from living in high-rise developments. These include high noise-levels and lack of playing-space for children. An architect shows plans for high-density housing which should overcome these problems while still providing housing for many people in relatively small areas. Set in Melbourne, Victoria. Narrated by Wynn Roberts. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: 15 Amore
results.creator_credit: MTXM Movies, Maurice Murphy and Brooke Wilson
results.brief_description: Based on the director/writer’s own childhood experiences, this period drama is set in an idyllic rural Australia during World War II when two Italian POW’s, a Jewish German woman and her daughter are billeted with a farmer’s wife and her three children on an isolated farmstead. Told from the point-of-view of a young boy, the daily existence of the characters as they grow closer to one another, seems harmonious and carefree. Yet beneath this tranquility simmers war- induced trauma, fear and cynicism which inevitably erupts. A perceptive look at cultural difference, this beautifully photographed film avoids slipping into nostalgia and stereotype by staying focused on the characters’ motivations and conflicting emotional states. Cast: Lisa Hensley, Steve Bastoni, Domenic Galati, Tara Jakszewicz, Gertrude Ingeborg, Rhianna Griffith, Bill Hunter. Photography by John Borck. Music by Carlo Giacco.

results.title: 15' Zondergrond = 15' Metromania = 15 Metromania
results.creator_credit: Bart Van den Bempt and Bert Hamelinck
results.brief_description: Bernd is the new security guard at the Metro underground. Just as he relaxes into the position, a stern boss dictates some impossible rules and young Bernd’s day goes from bad to worse. Drawing on the aesthetic of the surveillance industry, director Bart Van den Bempt parallels surveillance type images alongside the running plot with split screens. As Bernd, infatuation by a young woman, tracks her movements using the security cameras, we the audience tour the process of security camera surveillance. The film style and structure become bound to the processes of surveillance, whilst the process of surveillance informs the film structure (specifically the narrative and the editing style).

results.title: 147 break
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International, Paul Doherty and Eric Harrison
results.brief_description: Steve Davis became the first man in history to pot 15 reds, 15 blacks, plus all the colours in sequence under tournament conditions on television. This thrilling achievement is seen through Steve’s own eyes as he talks the viewer through the most difficult moments. Reminiscent of the “Pot Black” series and a must for snooker lovers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Granada Television International, Paul Doherty and Eric Harrison

results.title: 146,000 could live
results.brief_description: Dramatically presents each of the seven danger signals for cancer. Five are represented by people cured of cancer, one by a woman who lost her son to cancer and one by a man who notices a danger signal but found, when he went to a doctor, that he did not have cancer. Originally presented on television. Narrated by Charles S. Cameron.

results.title: 14 Days to Remember
results.creator_credit: I T N, Bob Whittington and Peter Hood
results.brief_description: A compilation of news footage covering historic events of the past thirty years: 1961 - East Germany builds the Berlin Wall; 1963 - U.S. President Kennedy is assassinated; 1968 - Soviet forces invade Czechoslovakia; 1969 - the first man on the moon; 1974 - the U.S. Watergate scandal; 1975 - the fall of Saigon ending the Vietnam War; 1980 - Iranian Embassy Siege; 1981 - the wedding of Britain’s Prince Charles and Lady Diana; 1982 - Britain invades the Falklands and wins back the islands; 1984 - the IRA attempt to blow up the entire British Cabinet meeting at Brighton; 1984 - Bhopal where poison gas leaks kill more than 3,000 Indians; 1986 - the Shuttle Disaster; 1986 - the Russian nuclear reactor at Chernobyl blows; 1988 - the tragedy of the Armenian earthquake.
